Key Arguments: The legislation establishes ACMA as a censorship body, controlling online content.
ACMA lacks the ability to determine what is true or false, making it unfit to enforce misinformation codes.
The legislation is a form of state censorship disguised as protection.
Misinformation and disinformation are terms used to justify censorship and control public discourse.
The legislation threatens free speech and democracy by allowing unelected bureaucrats to determine 'truth'.
The legislation will destroy platforms that provide refuge for dissident voices.
Main Themes: Inability of the state to determine truth
Threats to free speech and democracy
Criticism of the role of ACMA and its powers
Impact on alternative media and dissident voices
Notable Quotes: This legislation should therefore be rejected in full.
This is outsourced state censorship, totalitarian in scope, designed to control the public conversation and camouflaged as protection.
ACMA doesn't know what is true. It therefore cannot preside over misinformation codes of practice.
This legislation is a power grab by an unelected bureaucracy that would get to decide what 'misinformation' is for all of us and ban it, strangling our democracy.
